title: Hydrogen can make water on alien worlds: A study just rewrote how planets form oceans
description: Astronomers now understand that water-rich planets can form internally, even close to stars. A new study reveals that high-pressure reactions between hydrogen and molten rock within sub-Neptunes generate vast amounts of water. This discovery challenges previous notions of planetary formation and habitability, suggesting that 'dry' planets can indeed become 'wet' worlds through internal processes.

title: Explosion at Pakistan supreme court: Gas cylinder blast leaves 12 injured - video

Emergency services responded swiftly, and investigations are underway.

title: 'Seven cut out of my face': Michael Clarke reveals long battle with cancer

title: Bihar: Bridge collapses in Araria; built in 2019 for Rs 4 crore, traffic movement halted
description: A middle pillar of a four-crore rupee bridge in Bihar's Araria district collapsed on Monday, causing no injuries. The bridge, built in 2019 and connecting Forbesganj with Pategna village, has had all traffic halted. A technical team is investigating the incident, which follows a dozen bridge collapses in the state last year.

title: From Lahli to Navi Mumbai: Shafali Verma's return gift to idol Sachin
description: Twelve years after a nine-year-old Shafali Verma begged her father to take her to Lahli to see Sachin Tendulkar, the Rohtak girl returned the favour, gifting her idol a World Cup in his own backyard. With Tendulkar in the stands, Shafali’s bat and ball did the talking as life came full circle.

title: 'From Delhi to Dubai': Interpol's red notice against cartel heir; wanted in Rs 13,000cr drug haul
description: Interpol has issued a Red Notice for Rishabh Baisoya, a fugitive linked to a massive Rs 13,000-crore cocaine seizure. Believed to be in the Middle East, Baisoya is accused of facilitating drug transportation for his father's international cartel. Authorities are pursuing a global manhunt and a trial in absentia.

title: Cough syrup deaths: MP SIT arrests accused doctor’s wife; booked for hiding proof, aiding husband
Blake Treinen’s viral Charlie Kirk hat: What’s the real story?
description: A viral photo of Blake Treinen wearing a "Charlie Kirk" hat was falsely linked to the Dodgers' 2025 World Series win. The image actually dates back to a September 12 game, weeks before the championship, honoring a fallen TPUSA founder. Fact-checkers confirmed Treinen did not wear the tribute hat during the World Series celebration.

title: Faridabad horror: 17-year-old girl shot by jilted lover; attack caught on cam
description: A 17-year-old student was shot by a motorcyclist in Faridabad's Shyam Colony while returning from a library. The assailant fired a country-made pistol, hitting her shoulder and hand. Locals attempted to apprehend the fleeing attacker, who discarded his weapon. The girl is stable and receiving treatment. Police are investigating the motive and have identified a suspect.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
description: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: China shuts door: Nvidia CEO warns US risks losing global AI edge
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the US government to reconsider restrictions on China, warning that barring the company from the Chinese market risks ceding AI talent to rivals. Despite significant losses in China due to US export controls, Nvidia is securing major deals with the US Department of Energy, including supercomputers for national security.
